title: Ops Resilience: Never Again
description: Power is restored. The PM wants answers: who did this, how did they do it, and what prevents it from happening again? DIS has one week to brief Parliament.

software-engineer.title: Design the Permanent Defence
software-engineer.instruction: The attack exploited a gap between the SCADA network and IT network monitoring. Leadership wants a permanent technical solution. What do you propose?

options.label: Implement Zero Trust architecture for all OT/IT interactions. Every device, every request is verified before being granted access. Gold standard security but requires 18 months of implementation.
Deploy an AI powered Security Operations Centre that monitors both IT and OT networks 24/7. Detects anomalies in real time and auto responds to known threat patterns. Can be operational in 3 months.
Physically air gap all critical SCADA systems from any internet connected network. The ultimate defence but makes remote management impossible and requires on-site engineers for every update.
Create a Five Eyes style threat sharing programme with regional utilities. Share attack signatures in real time so everyone benefits from each country's incidents.

data-scientist.title: Build the Attribution Report
data-scientist.instruction: Intelligence points to a state actor but the PM needs rock solid evidence before Parliament. Put these attribution analysis steps in the right order.

items.label: Match the attacker's tools and techniques against known threat actor playbooks
Trace command and control infrastructure through multiple proxy layers
Analyse the malware code for language, error messages, and compile artefacts
Check attack timing against time zones and known working hours of suspect groups
Write a calibrated confidence statement that is honest about certainty levels

cloud-engineer.title: Design the Resilience Architecture
cloud-engineer.instruction: Design a resilient infrastructure that survives future attacks. Drag each component to the right layer. Area 1 is prevention, Areas 2 and 3 are detection and response, Area 4 is recovery.
